title: How to Catch the Legendary Dogs in Pokémon Gold and Silver

steps.title: Get a Pokémon who knows the Mean Look.
steps.content: Get a Pokémon who knows the Mean Look. The Legendary Dogs, though strong, prefer to run on the first chance they get. To prevent them from running, get a Pokémon that knows the move Mean Look. This move prevents the foe from fleeing. Two best choices are: Gengar (learns at level 13) and Crobat (level 42).

steps.title: Get a sleep-inducing Pokémon to put the dog to sleep.
steps.content: Get a sleep-inducing Pokémon to put the dog to sleep. This makes catching them easier.

steps.title: Stock up on Ultra Balls (at least 30+ for one dog).
steps.content: Stock up on Ultra Balls (at least 30+ for one dog).

steps.title: Start the search near a place where you can easily change locations and there is tall grass nearby.
steps.content: Start the search near a place where you can easily change locations and there is tall grass nearby. Keep in mind the dogs change their position when you enter/exit through a door or use fly to change location. The best preferred location is Route 38 where you can easily switch location by passing through the western gate of Ecruteak City.

steps.title: Keep your mean look using Pokémon at front of your Pokémon party (below level 40).
steps.content: Keep your mean look using Pokémon at front of your Pokémon party (below level 40). Use Max Repel. Enter the grass and roam for around 15-20 seconds.

steps.title: Change position if needed.
steps.content: Change position if needed. If no dog shows up, then change location by passing through the door. This will change the locations of the dogs. Come back to Route 38 and start searching in the grass with your Max Repel on.

steps.title: Track them.
steps.content: Track them. If you encounter the dogs even once, you can track them using your Pokédex. Just go to the Pokémon entry in your Pokédex and select Area.

steps.title: Keep your Mean Look Pokémon in front of your party.
steps.content: Keep your Mean Look Pokémon in front of your party. It will be sent out when you encounter the dog. Use Mean Look right away to prevent the Pokémon from running.

steps.title: Damage the Pokémon a little bit:
steps.content: Damage the Pokémon a little bit: Use your sleep inducing Pokémon to put it to sleep. Start using your Pokémon to attack it using weaker moves. Scyther with False Swipe are good options.

steps.title: Once the health is in low zone, start tossing out the Ultra Balls.
steps.content: Once the health is in low zone, start tossing out the Ultra Balls. After many tries, you will catch the dog. Congrats!!

steps.title: Repeat the same process for other two legendary dogs!
steps.content: Repeat the same process for other two legendary dogs!
